title: I was genuinely worried you'd make Veigar edgy, like what happened to Zac
body:

replies.body: If anything, Veigar has more reason to be edgy than Zac tho
Rather than lament his misfortune, Veigar embraced it. That is what makes him extraordinary.
When the reply has more likes than the actual comment.
Zac... Edgy? Didn't think I'd see those two words together
I believe the main reason people call Zac's new lore "edgy" is because post-retcon, his parents got killed, whereas originally they were both alive and well.

Ahh I shoulda figured. Honestly that one change is my least favorite of all the new lore updates (and I like the new lore alot). 
Still, I don't know if I'd call Zac "edgy" over it. I just find that word is thrown around a lot imo.

When Riot murdered Zac's parents, they made it so he now skulks in the water pipes of Zaun, and only pops out to save people who are getting attacked, like a goopy Batman. They definitely tried to make him "edgy" in his lore, which is a huge disconnect from the plucky, cheerful guy who loves his mom that we see in the game. And like you, I detest it, because Zac was unique in that he was by all means a monster who had managed to find love with a family who didn't care he was a goo monster.

IDK what you're talking about dude.

I've never seen a darker, more powerful, more maniacal villain in written history. Veigar is about as edgy, dark and powerful as things get. No way I can't NOT take him seriously.
I think everyone might be using "edgy" to mean different things...
Right? I mean how is Zac  "_edgy_"? He's all round and bouncy....

Honestly, edgy is what you make of it. If his parents were alive, then "YAY! NONE EDGINESS!" Congrats. His parents will be under siege every Saturday morning cause a certain Chem-baron knows they still live in Zaun.

Why don't they just leave Zaun!?!?!?

Then, Zac...won't be in Zaun. And now people will be like "Wait, why are you taking Zac out of Zaun?"

But...the parents just letting this happen would be...bad writing. Killing his parents suck ass, sure but...they were a legitimate loose end that had their own dillemas that wouldn't be easily solved by just saying, "Do whatever you want kid."

Cause, unlike Ekko, they weren't absentee parents.

His parents were not a loose end, and I can tell you how they could keep them alive AND keep Zac in Zaun - have Zac choose to stay.

 It's quite simple really. Instead of having his parents die in the Chem-Baron attack like Riot did, have them survive and realize how dangerous Zaun is. They begin packing up their life and their work, to move somewhere far away and remote so they can continue their research in peace. Except Zac has seen the evilness of the chem-barons, and how they terrorize the people of Zaun, and he makes a decision to stay in Zaun to protect the people and make right the wrongs that the Barons are committing there and so he can make it safe again for his parents to return home. His parents give him their blessing, understanding that they need to let their chick fly from the nest some day, and leave Zaun. 

Boom. Problems solved. Parents live. Zac stays in Zaun. Zac makes sense being plucky and happy since his parents are alive and he's doing good in the world. Zac ALSO achieves the superhero sub-theme that he has going for him by making the noble, pure decision to stay in his troubled city and clean up the crime there. It actually does a helluva lot more for Zac's characterization too because it crystalizes the life lessons his parents have taught him, and develops them into strong character traits like a sense of justice and a desire to make the world better and makes them more human and personal to him because _he_ makes the choice to stay and do good for the people of Zaun.
To clarify, Zac's new lore is a bit edgy (Parents ded now). Zac is still a nice ~~slime ~~guy. Yeah, I felt like that was really unnecessary.
